title: Browned Cabbage with Garlic
introduction: Browned Cabbage with Garlic transforms the humble cabbage into a flavorful delight. This dish, inspired by an Italian family recipe, involves slow-cooking the cabbage until it turns rich and sweet, with a savory hint of garlic and a touch of heat from crushed red pepper. It's a perfect example of how careful cooking can elevate simple ingredients into something truly special.
instructions: Trim off the outer leaves of the cabbage. With a large heavy chef's knife, cut the cabbage into quarters. Cut out the core. Cut the cabbage into bite-size pieces.
In a large pot, cook the garlic and red pepper in the olive oil over medium-low heat until the garlic is golden, about 2 minutes.
Add the cabbage and salt. Stir well. Cover and cook, stirring often, for 20 minutes, or until the cabbage is lightly browned and tender. Add a little water if the cabbage begins to stick. Serve hot.
